definition: to hop/to jump on one leg
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
to jump/to hop/to skip over/to bounce/to palpitate

sentences.english: He got hurt in the left leg and had to hop along.
sentences.chinese: 他左脚受了伤，只得单脚跳着走。

sentences.english: No more hopping on the bed, Or your teeth will turn rosy red.
sentences.chinese: 别再床上单脚跳，否则牙齿将染红。

sentences.english: Three little kangaroos hopped on the bed.
sentences.chinese: 三只小袋鼠在床上单脚跳。

sentences.english: The Fox jumped and stretched and hopped and reached.
sentences.chinese: 狐狸往上跳，全身伸展，也单脚跳跃试著要抓到葡萄。

sentences.english: Three kangaroos hopped on the bed.
sentences.chinese: 三只小袋鼠在床上单脚跳。

sentences.english: When I hop , I have hope.
sentences.chinese: 当我单脚跳，我就有希望。

sentences.english: He was so excited, he hopped from foot to foot.
sentences.chinese: 他兴奋地两只脚轮换着单脚跳。

sentences.english: No more hopping on the bed.
Create a circle while hopping on one foot.
sentences.chinese: 游戏要求玩家单脚跳跃，同时，组成一个圈。

definition: to kick one's legs/leg press (exercise)/(coll.) to kick the bucket
to run up (pole vault, javelin, bowling etc)/approach/run-up/(aviation) takeoff run
to tread water/to paddle or tramp in shallow water
to jump/to hop/to skip over/to bounce/to palpitate
